articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects KPA Air Force Unit
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects KPA Air Force Unit
Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il inspected KPA Air Force Unit 814.
					 He watched pilots' flight training after acquainting himself with the unit's performance of duty.
					
					 Watching the training of matchless courageous airmen, he expressed great satisfaction over the fact that the unit has fully prepared all of them to be human bombs in the sky like hero Kil Yong Jo. He advanced tasks to be fulfilled by the unit to increase its combat capability in every way.
					
					 All the pilots are strong in ideology and faith as they are replete with ardent patriotism to readily dedicate their youth and lives to defending the country, he said, adding that the country is impregnable as such loyal ranks are reliably standing guard over the blue sky of the country.
					
					 To live heroically and become a hero means the most worthwhile life and the greatest honor for an independent human being, he remarked, urging all of them to become heroes in the sacred struggle to defend the country.
					
					 He moved on to a women's company under the direct control of the unit. He took warm care of its soldiers' service and living as a real father would do, making the rounds of an educational room, a bedroom, a mess hall, a wash-cum-bath house, a daily provision store and other places.
					
					 He was greatly pleased to learn that the company has successfully built entertainment and educational facilities as well as supply service facilities and conducted effective political and ideological work in various forms and by diverse methods and that all its soldiers have fully enjoyed a cultural and emotional life.
					
					 He highly praised the soldiers of the company for having brought about innovations in stock-breeding and sideline farming with extraordinary enthusiasm.
					
					 Noting that the appearance of all the units has undergone a radical change, he said that this signal turn is the precious fruition of a high degree of revolutionary character, militancy, organization and discipline, the special qualities of the KPA that has carried forward the glorious traditions of the anti-Japanese struggle.
					
					 He had a photo session with the servicepersons of the unit.
					
					 He was accompanied by Jang Song Thaek, member of the NDC of the DPRK and department director of the WPK Central Committee, and KPA Generals Hyon Chol Hae and Ri Myong Su.

articles.title: Greetings to Yemeni President
articles.content:
Greetings to Yemeni President
Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greetings to Ali Abdullah Saleh, President of Yemen, on the occasion of the 19th national holiday.
					Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Yemen would grow stronger, Kim in the message wished the President and people of Yemen successes in their efforts for the stability and development of the country.

articles.title: Indonesian Parliamentary Delegation Feted
articles.content:
Indonesian Parliamentary Delegation Feted
Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Supreme People's Assembly hosted a banquet at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday in honor of the delegation of the Parliament of Indonesia led by Speaker Agung Laksono on a visit to the DPRK.
					 Present there on invitation were members of the delegation led by Speaker Agung Laksono, the Indonesian ambassador to the DPRK and staff members of the Indonesian embassy here.
					
					  Present there were Chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly Choe Thae Bok and officials concerned.
					
					  Choe Thae Bok said in his speech made there that the Indonesian people have made energetic endeavors to build a stable, peaceful, just and democratic country under the leadership of President Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono.
					
					  Noting that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Indonesia have steadily grown stronger under deep care of the leaders of the two countries, Choe stressed that the DPRK would make positive efforts to boost the relations with Indonesia in different fields including politics, economy and culture.
					
					Referring to the fact that the friendly relations between the two countries were provided by President Sukarno and President Kim Il Sung, Agung Laksono noted that Indonesia was recorded in history as the country which General Secretary Kim Jong Il visited, accompanying Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Saying that Indonesia and the DPRK have always supported each other on the principle of territorial integrity and non-interference in each other's internal affairs, he expressed his hope that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to grow strong in different fields in the future, too.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Delegation of BWP
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Delegation of BWP
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with the delegation of the Brazilian Workers' Party led by Valter Pomar, secretary for International Relations of its National Executive Committee, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Thursday.
					 The head of the delegation said that the BWP wants to develop the exchange with various organizations in the DPRK.
					
					 The BWP would make positive efforts to develop the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties and peoples of the two countries, he added.

articles.title: Talks between Delegations of WPK and BWP Held
articles.content:
Talks between Delegations of WPK and BWP Held
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) --Talks between the delegations of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Brazilian Workers' Party were held here on Thursday.
					 Present at the talks from the WPK side were members of the WPK delegation led by Kim Jung Rin, secretary of its Central Committee, and from the BWP side members of the BWP delegation headed by Valter Pomar, secretary for International Relations of its National Executive Committee.
					
					  At the talks both sides exchanged views on the issue of boosting the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties and matters of mutual interest.

articles.title: Brazilian Delegation Feted
articles.content:
Brazilian Delegation Feted
Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea gave a reception at Pyongyang Koryo Hotel on Wednesday in honor of the visiting delegation of the Brazilian Workers' Party.
					  Present at the reception on invitation were members of the delegation led by Secretary for International Relations of its National Executive Committee Valter Pomar.
					
					 Secretary Kim Jung Rin and officials of the Central Committee of the WPK were present there.
					
					 Kim Jung Rin said in his speech at the reception that the Brazilian Workers' Party has played a leading role in the work to achieve the independent development in the region.
					
					 Wishing the Brazilian Workers' Party fresh success in its activities to improve the people's living conditions and develop the country's economy, he expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the parties and peoples of the two countries would grow stronger in the idea of independence, peace and friendship.
					
					 Valter Pomar in his speech said he was confident that the current visit would mark an important occasion in getting better knowledge about the DPRK's reality and exchanging each other's views.
					
					 He expressed belief that the delegation's visit would contribute to developing the relations between the two parties and hoped that the Korean people would achieve greater success in their struggle and the relations between the Brazilian Workers' Party and the WPK would develop on better terms.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Brazilian Workers' Party
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Brazilian Workers' Party
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the Brazilian Workers' Party.
					 It was conveyed to Kim Jung Rin, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, by Valter Pomar, secretary for International Relations of the National Executive Committee of the BWP, on a visit to the DPRK on Thursday.

articles.title: Officials Visit Revolutionary Battle Sites and Revolutionary Sites
articles.content:
Officials Visit Revolutionary Battle Sites and Revolutionary Sites
Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- Officials of party and armed forces organs, ministries and national institutions of the DPRK on Thursday visited revolutionary battle sites and revolutionary sites in the area of Mt. Paektu on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of the victory in the battles in the Musan area commanded by President Kim Il Sung.
					  Kim Yong Chun, Choe Thae Bok and Choe Yong Rim and officials of party and armed forces organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions laid floral baskets and bouquets before the statues of Kim Il Sung standing on the shore of Lake Samji and in the Chongbong Bivouac and paid tribute to him.
					
					 After being briefed on the Samjiyon Revolutionary Battle Site, they went round the Samjiyon Grand Monument and other revolutionary sites.
					
					 They continued their visit along the same course as covered by the main unit of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army led by the President when marching in fine array along the "Kapsan-Musan guard road" built by the enemy.
					
					 They looked round the sites of the command, barked trees bearing slogans, sites of campfires and cooking and others in the Chongbong, Konchang and Pegaebong bivouacs.

articles.title: 12th Cycle WAG International Judges' Course Held
articles.content:
12th Cycle WAG International Judges' Course Held
Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- The 12th Cycle WAG International Judges' Course was held recently at the Table-Tennis Gymnasium in Chongchun Street, Pyongyang.
					The course was attended by coaches and judges of women's heavy gymnastics from different sports teams.
					
					The course, divided into theoretical and practical ones, dealt with the technical rules and marking regulations renewed by the International Gymnastics Federation (FIG) and others.
					
					The course was presided over by Donattela Sachi, the first vice-chairwoman of the FIG WAG TC.

articles.title: Seminar on Feature Film Held
articles.content:
Seminar on Feature Film Held
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- A seminar of Juche-based literary and art idea on the feature film "A White Gem" (Parts 1 and 2) of the DPRK was held on May 20.
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 The speakers explained that the film represented the urgent and significant theme of the times on a high ideological and artistic level by impressively showing the warm revolutionary comradeship and the world of noble obligation between the leader and his soldier.
					
					 They noted that innovations were made in the film editing and shooting through successful application of the Workers' Party of Korea's idea and theory on Juche-oriented literature and art.
					
					 They underlined the need for all the creators and artistes to firmly arm themselves with the Party's idea and theory on literature and art and produce more masterpieces of the Songun era in the course of a new great revolutionary surge by making effective use of the successes and experience gained in the production of the feature film "A White Gem" and thus develop the Juche-based cinematic art onto a higher level.

articles.title: New Stamps Issued
articles.content:
New Stamps Issued
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- Eight kinds of new individual stamps have been issued on marking the golden jubilee for both of the Central Zoo and the Central Botanical Garden in the DPRK.
					 President Kim Il Sung personally came out to the foot of Mt. Taesong in April Juche 48 (1959) and designated sites of the zoo and the garden in order to provide the people with cultural living conditions.
					
					 The stamps carry pictures of Accipiter gentilis, Anthropoides paradisea, Larus argentatus and Balearica pavonina as well as Catalpa ovata, Betula Platyphylla, Juglans cordifomis and Metasequoia glyptostroboides.
					
					 Also published are another eight kinds of new individual stamps showing the training of sportspersons and diversified camping life of schoolchildren.

articles.title: Technology for Creating Comprehensive Greenbelt Developed
articles.content:
Technology for Creating Comprehensive Greenbelt Developed
Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- The Institute of City Management Science under the State Academy of Sciences has of late developed the technology for laying out comprehensive greenbelts, drawing the attention of the people.
					The technology makes it possible to cover the whole country with forests on a long-term basis by solving the technical issues arising in working out plans for afforestation and in implementing them to suit the actual conditions of the country.
					
					Scientists of the institute have also made many successes in breeding and cultivating soil-covering plants suitable for the climate and natural features of the country.
					
					They have bred new kinds of superior turf by crossing golden turf strong in resistance to drought and blight and rather endurable to treading with other species of turf which keep green color for a long time and are resistant to cold.
					
					They also developed a technology of cultivating turf without soil so as to increase turf output and save manpower and time.
					
					This technology has been applied widely to main streets and various districts of Pyongyang City and various local areas of the country.

articles.title: KCNA on Japan's Rightist Trend
articles.content:
KCNA on Japan's Rightist Trend
Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- The conservative rightist trend is rampant in Japan at present.
					 The influence of the Japanese rightist forces finds a vivid expression in the issue of visit to "Yasukuni Shrine."
					
					 The LDP, a group of ultra-rightists of Japan, said in its "action program" for 2009 that it should carry forward the visit to "Yasukuni Shrine" as a responsible conservative political party.
					
					 It is zealously egging the prime minister on to visit the shrine in every way.
					
					 It asserts that it is a natural duty of the leader of Japan to pay respects to the departed soul of those who died for the sake of the country and he should continue paying a visit to it.
					
					 It is zealously encouraging the prime minister in his visit to it by wooing the rightist forces within the party to bluster that the prime minister's visit is a domestic issue and for him to visit the shrine despite the pressure at home and abroad is of great significance.
					
					 Pursuant to it, Prime Minister Aso recently presented potted branches of commemorative trees to "Yasukuni Shrine" on his behalf.
					
					 On May 11 former Prime Minister Abe said that there should be an environment so that the prime minister might legitimately visit "Yasukuni Shrine."
					
					 Endless militarist remarks are heard from Japan and the reckless moves of the ultra-right conservative groups openly denying, distorting and whitewashing the past history of aggression are being connived at, allowed and patronized there.
					
					 To lay a political and military foundation for overseas aggression is the most important issue for the Japanese rightist elements whose primary goal is militarization.
					
					 Their priority task is to train a large number of innocent youngsters in such a manner as to be capable of carrying out a war of aggression in future by taking advantage of the neo-fascist atmosphere mounting throughout the society.
					
					 The influence of the rightist forces is growing stronger in Japan as the days go by.
					
					 The rightist conservatives who have emerged hardcore and leading forces of the political circle are keen to realize their ambition they failed to do in the past, holding sway over the political mainstream in Japan. This cannot be construed otherwise than a very grave development.
					
					 Incumbent Prime Minister Aso strong in the rightist tendency has frequently denied the past history of aggression before and after he took office.
					
					 Recently he described the Pacific war ignited by the Japanese imperialists as the "greater East Asia war." Under the Aso regime the textbook for secondary schoolers distorting history passed through the government's screening on April 9.
					
					 The said history textbook describes the Japanese invasion of Korea in 1592 as "dispatch of troops", not as aggression, and the Pacific war as the "greater East Asia war." 
					
					 Militarism has already become a main source of Asian aggression in Japan influenced by the rightist conservative political view as it has a dangerous political and military impact, far from remaining a departed soul.
					
					 In recent years the Japanese Diet has deliberated and adopted various kinds of military laws and regulations or revised ones almost every year, thus establishing in the main a legal system including a legislation for wartime mobilization. As a result, the conversion of Japan into a military power has already become part of the state strategic system.
					
					 Japan has steadily increased the military spending and developed highly scientific and technological equipment, thereby bolstering up the "Self-Defense Forces" as the armed forces fully capable of conducting operations and fighting a real war.
					
					 Japan dispatched destroyers of the "Maritime Self-Defense Force" to the waters off Somalia on the basis of the enlarged interpretation of the "law on SDF" under the pretext of performing its "international duty" and "ensuring the security" in the international sea route. On May 18 it sent an advance party to dispatch P-3C of the MSDF there in a bid to get it start fulfilling its real duty overseas.
					
					 The military muscle of Japan is rapidly increasing as it has already grown strong as a result of huge military spending and the backing of the rightist forces at home.
					
					 It is clear that militarist Japan may launch reinvasion any time.
					
					 The danger of Japan's veer to Right lies in the revival of militarism.
					
					 The revived Japanese militarism, the second war force, may plunge not only Asia but the rest of the world into a horrible war disaster again.
					
					 This is the reason why the international community should heighten the vigilance against the rightist trend of thought in Japan and strictly guard against it.

articles.title: Resolution to Struggle for Reunification Declared in S. Korea
articles.content:
Resolution to Struggle for Reunification Declared in S. Korea
Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- Personages of different circles in south Korea made public a declaration on May 15 in denunciation of the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors' moves against the nation, democracy and reunification.
					 The declaration deplored that democracy and people's livelihood have been violated and the people's desire for peace and reunification mercilessly trampled down in south Korea due to the Lee Myung Bak "government's" misrule.
					
					 Owing to the "government's" confrontation policy, the inter-Korean relations have been extremely deteriorated and dark clouds of war are getting denser in the Korean Peninsula, it pointed out.
					
					 It stressed that the elders who have dedicated themselves to the movement for social democracy and reunification would actively turn out in the struggle to implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and realize independence, democracy and reunification.
					
					 Lee Myung Bak is mistaken if he intends to check the activities of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification and other progressive forces by violence, the declaration said, stressing that the reunification movement will grow stronger and emerge victorious without fail.

articles.title: S. Korean Youths Vow to Lead Struggle for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration
articles.content:
S. Korean Youths Vow to Take Lead in Struggle for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- Fifty-six youth organizations in south Korea inaugurated a preparatory committee for the south Korean Federation of Youth Organizations and declared that they would take the lead in the struggle for defending and implementing the June 15 joint declaration.
					 Speakers at its inaugural meeting on May 17 said that the progressive youth organizations would organize a new federation and wage a positive youth movement.
					
					 They stressed that the federation would concentrate its efforts on the struggle to defend and implement the June 15 joint declaration, check the authorities' crackdown on the progressive forces and protest the enactment of Lee Myung Bak's evil laws.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- Wang Tiankai, head of the delegation of the China National Textile and Apparel Council who visited the DPRK, praised the whole life of President Kim Il Sung as the revolutionary life of the peerlessly great man who devoted himself to the country's liberation and prosperity.
					 In an interview with a journalist he said that the President who performed great exploits for the era and history is always alive in the hearts of the Korean people and the world progressives.
					
					Visiting the International Friendship Exhibition House, we could not repress our admiration at the huge amount of gifts the President and General Secretary Kim Jong Il received from party and state leaders and prominent figures of many countries, he said.
					
					 He remarked that he took off his hat to the noble personalities of the peerlessly great men who made those gifts serve as wealth of the people.
					
					 The President is the great leader of the Korean people and a close friend of the Chinese people, he said, stressing that not only the Chinese people but also the world people are boundlessly revering him.

articles.title: Japanese Authorities Urged to Lift Sanctions against DPRK
articles.content:
Japanese Authorities Urged to Lift Sanctions against DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- The Aichi Society for the Promotion of the Japan-DPRK Educational and Cultural Exchange on May 1 handed to the Ministry of the Cabinet and the Foreign Ministry an appeal and a written request of personages of various circles in Aichi Prefecture addressed to the prime minister and the foreign minister, demanding the government lift economic sanctions against the DPRK and stop the human right abuses against the Koreans in Japan.
					 Takeuchi Koichi, secretary general of the society, conveying the appeal and the written request, pointed to the situation on the Korean Peninsula and the relations between the two countries further strained since the DPRK's satellite launch.
					
					 The Japanese government's extension of sanctions against the DPRK and its unreasonable suppression of Koreans in Japan can never be allowed, he said, urging the government to immediately lift the sanctions, resume the talks for the normalization of the relations between the two countries and respect the rights of the Koreans in Japan in the spirit of the Japan-DPRK Pyongyang Declaration.
					
					 In the meantime, the Nagano Prefectural People's Council for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea sent a written protest to the residence of the prime minister, the Foreign Ministry and the Ministry of Defence as regards the step taken by the government against the DPRK over its satellite launch.
					
					 The written protest criticized the Japanese government for trumpeting about the "threat from north Korea" and stirring up antagonism and distrust between Japan and the DPRK, claiming that the satellite is a missile and demanded the government halt the extension of the sanctions and opt for dialogue with the DPRK.

articles.title: Cause of Korean People and Youth Supported by WFDY
articles.content:
Cause of Korean People and Youth Supported by WFDY
Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- A meeting of the General Council of the World Federation of Democratic Youth (WFDY) held in Cuba on May 8 and 9 expressed full support with the just cause of the people and youth of the DPRK.
					 A political statement, adopted at the meeting, branded the U.S. forces in south Korea as the biggest obstacle to the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea and the chieftain of a new war of aggression and said that the WFDY strongly urges the U.S. to withdraw all its aggression forces and military bases from the Korean Peninsula and its surrounding areas at once.
					
					 The statement denounced the reckless anti-DPRK moves of the U.S. taking issue with the DPRK's satellite launch for peaceful purposes.
					
					 An action program for 2009, adopted at the meeting, clarified that the organization would strengthen the solidarity with the Korean people and youth in the struggle to get the U.S. forces withdrawn from south Korea and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country in the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					
					 A statement of solidarity with the Korean people and youth was adopted at the meeting. It said that the WFDY calls upon all the progressive people and youth in the world to extend solidarity to the just cause of the Korean people and youth for the country's independent and peaceful reunification and join in the common struggle to resolutely smash the aggression and war moves of the U.S. imperialists and their followers threatening the world peace and security.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il inspecciona Unidad no. 814 de fuerzas aereas del EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il inspecciona Unidad no. 814 de fuerzas aereas del EPC
Pyongyang, 21 de mayo (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, inspecciono la Unidad no. 814 de las fuerzas aereas del EPC.
					 Luego de hacer conocimiento del cumplimiento de la mision por la unidad, el Comandante Supremo contemplo el vuelo de entrenamiento de los aviadores.
					
					 Al presenciar este ejercicio marcado por el invencible coraje, se mostro muy satisfecho de que esa unidad forma a todos los pilotos como combatientes del cielo capaces de estallarse como bombas al igual que el heroe Kil Yong Jo, y presento las tareas para fortalecer por todos los medios la combatividad de ella.
					
					 Todos los aviadores son los fuertes en la idea y conviccion, colmados del calido patriotismo con que ofrendaran sin vacilacion alguna su juventud y vida por defender la patria, senalo y anadio que gracias a estas filas leales que defienden fidedignamente el cielo azul de la patria, nuestro pais es una fortaleza inexpugnable.
					
					 Vivir heroicamente y ser heroe constituye para el ser humano independiente la vida mas digna y valiosa y el honor mas grande, apunto y exhorto a todos a convertirse en heroes en la sagrada batalla por defender la patria.
					
					 Seguidamente, el Comandante Supremo visito una compania femenina adscrita directamente a la unidad donde atendio con afecto paternal la vida y el trabajo de las militares recorriendo varios puntos como la sala de educacion, el dormitorio, el comedor, el bano, el deposito diario, etc.
					
					 Se puso muy contento de que se acondicionaron magnificamente las instalaciones culturales, educacionales y de intendencia, se realizan sustancialmente de diferentes maneras y metodos las labores politicas e ideologicas y todas las militares llevan en lo suficiente su vida cultural.
					
					 Aprecio mucho el hecho de que ellas produjeron una innovacion en la ganaderia y las faenas agricolas de autoabastecimiento dando pruebas de su extraordinario entusiasmo.
					
					 Asevero que hoy dia, se renueva la fisonomia de todas las unidades y continuo que este cambio esplendido es el valioso fruto del fuerte caracter revolucionario, combativo, organizado y disciplinado que tipifica al Ejercito Popular de Corea, heredero de las brillantes tradiciones de la guerrilla antijaponesa.
					
					 Por ultimo, se fotografio junto a los militares de la unidad.
					
					 Le acompanaron en esta ocasion Jang Song Thaek, miembro del CDN de la RPDC y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, y los generales de ejercito del EPC, Hyon Chol Hae y Ri Myong Su.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion del PTB
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion del PTB
Pyongyang, 21 de mayo (ATCC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, departio el dia 21 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae en un clima amistoso con la delegacion del Partido de los Trabajadores de Brasil encabezada por el secretario de relaciones internacionales del Directorio Nacional, Valter Pomar.
					  En la ocasion, el jefe de la delegacion brasilena expreso el deseo del PTB de ampliar el intercambio con varias entidades coreanas.
					
					  Afirmo que su partido se esforzaria activamente por desarrollar las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos partidos y los pueblos de ambos paises.

articles.title: CC del PTC ofrece banquete en honor de delegacion del PTB
articles.content:
CC del PTC ofrece banquete en honor de delegacion del PTB
Pyongyang, 21 de mayo (ATCC) -- El Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea ofrecio el dia 20 en el capitalino Hotel Coryo de Pyongyang en honor de la delegacion del Partido de los Trabajadores de Brasil presidida por el secretario de relaciones internacionales del Directorio Nacional Valter Pomar, de visita en Corea.
					  A la recepcion fueron invitados los miembros de la delegacion del PTB.
					
					  Estuvieron presentes alli el secretario Kim Jung Rin y otros funcionarios del CC del PTC.
					
					 En su discurso Kim Jung Rin se refirio a que el Partido de los Trabajadores de Brasil desempena el papel directivo en la labor para lograr el desarrollo independiente de la region.
					
					  Dijo que el PTC desea al PTB  nuevos exitos en sus actividades para mejorar las condiciones de vida del pueblo y desarrollar la economia del pais y expreso su conviccion de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los partidos y los pueblos de los dos paises se desarrollaran conforme al ideal de la independencia, la paz y la amistad.
					
					  Valter Pomar, en su discurso, subrayo que esta seguro que la presente visita servira de importante motivo para conocer bien la realidad de Corea e intercambiar opiniones.
					
					  Manifesto confianza de que la visita de la delegacion contribuira a desarrollar las relaciones entre los dos partidos y deseo al pueblo coreano  mayores exitos en su lucha y  el desarrollo mas favorable de las  relaciones entre el PTB y el PTC.

articles.title: ATCC comenta la corriente derechista de Japon
articles.content:
ATCC comenta la corriente derechista de Japon
Pyongyang, 21 de mayo (ATCC) -- En estos tiempos, Japon es contagiado de la tendencia derechista y conservadora.
					  El tema de la visita al "Santuario Yasukuni" es la muestra tipica de lo influyentes que son las fuerzas derechistas de Japon.
					
					  El Partido Democratico Liberal, grupo ultraderechista, estipulo en su "proyecto de orientacion de actividades" del ano 2009 esta frase: "daremos continuidad a la visita al  como responsable partido politico conservador".
					
					  Ademas, insiste en que "el mandatario japones debe seguir visitando a ese lugar porque expresar el respeto a los que murieron por el pais es su deber natural".
					
					  Las fuerzas derechistas dentro del PDL instigan activamente la visita del premier al santuario hablando que "esto es un asunto interno" y "tiene mucha importancia a pesar de la presion interna y externa".
					
					  Hace poco, el premier Aso envio ofrendas a su nombre al "Santuario Yasukuni".
					
					  Y el ex premier Abe dijo el 11 de mayo que "hace falta dar el ambiente para la visita publica del premier al ".
					
					  En ese pais isleno se pronuncian sin escrupulos los disparates militaristas y son toleradas tacitamente y amparadas las locuras de las fracciones conservadoras ultraderechistas que niegan, tergiversan y elogian abiertamente la historia de agresiones del pasado.
					
					   Resulta un problema de capital importancia para ellos, que toman por su primera meta la militarizacion del pais, echar la firme base politica y militar para la agresion a ultramar.
					
					  Lo prioritario de ello es formar a muchos jovenes barbaros, que se encarguen de las futuras guerras de agresion, aprovechando el clima neofascista que se hace cada vez mas fuerte en toda la sociedad japonesa.
					
					 Hoy dia, crecen cada dia mas las influencias de las fuerzas derechistas de Japon.
					
					 Los elementos conservadores derechistas, que emergieron como nucleo del circulo politico, encauzan la principal corriente politica y se desesperan por realizar sus rancias ambiciones, lo cual es peligrosisima evolucion de la situacion.
					
					  Antes y despues de la toma del poder, Aso, figura de fuerte matiz derechista, vino negandose a la historia de agresiones del pasado.
					
					 Recientemente, el describio la Guerra del Pacifico provocada por los imperialistas de su pais en el siglo pasado como la "Guerra para la gran Asia Oriental". 
					
					 En el regimen de Aso, el manual para la escuela secundaria, que se redacto tergiversando la historia, paso el 9 de abril el examen del gobierno.
					
					 En este libro la "agresion de Japon a Corea en el ano Imjin (1592)" fue interpretada como "movilizacion de las tropas" y la Guerra del Pacifico, como la "guerra para la gran Asia Oriental". 
					
					  En ese pais isleno imbuido de la concepcion politica ultraderechista y conservadora, el militarismo ya no es algo fantasmal sino el peligroso ente politico-militar que se convertira en el caudillo agresor de Asia.
					
					 En los ultimos anos, la dieta japonesa abordo y aprobo casi todos los anos las reglas militares de diversos generos y los proyectos de enmienda, de modo que quedara establecido en lo fundamental el sistema legal, incluyendo la movilizacion en el tiempo de guerra.
					
					 La conversion del pais en una potencia militar ya se hizo una parte del sistema estrategico estatal.
					
					  Mientras tanto, las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" se convirtieron en las dotadas de gran capacidad operacional y combatividad gracias al constante aumento de gastos militares y al desarrollo de los equipos fabricados con la ciencia y tecnologia de punta.
					
					 Ademas, bajo el pretexto del cumplimiento de la "responsabilidad internacional" y la "preservacion de la seguridad" de rutas maritimas internacionales, Japon envio el buque escolta de las "Fuerzas Maritimas de Autodefensa" al mar frente a Somalia parafraseando a su manera la "ley de las Fuerzas de Autodefensa".
					
					  Seguidamente, el 18 del mes en curso, partio al mismo destino la avanzada para posibilitar el despacho del "P-3C" de las "Fuerzas Maritimas de Autodefensa", la cual ya entro en el cumplimiento de su mision en ultramar.
					
					 Estan en el proceso de expansion las fuerzas armadas de Japon que se han fortalecido gracias a los fabulosos gastos militares y por la instigacion de los ultraderechistas nacionales.
					
					 Es indiscutible que Japon militarizado tomara en cualquier momento el camino de reagresion.
					
					  El renacimiento del militarismo, he aqui el caracter peligroso de la derechizacion de Japon.
					
					  Es del todo posible que el resucitado militarismo japones, segunda fuerza belica, imponga otra vez los desastres de guerra a los pueblos asiaticos y del resto del mundo.
					
					  Por esta razon, la sociedad internacional debe tomar precaucion especial de la corriente derechista de Japon.
